availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Thomas A. Curran (Mason County, Kentucky, attorney and postmaster)

body.p: Mason County, Kentucky, attorney and postmaster. Harrison County, Kentucky native. Married to Hannah Chambers Curran. Captain of 16th Kentucky Volunteer Infantry (U.S.A.) during the Civil War. Postmaster in Dover, Kentucky in 1863.

ab.bibl: “Historical Sketch of Dover,” The Mason County Genealogical Society Newsletter 9 (1991), 76. Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Harrison County, District 1, p. 98. Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Mason County, Dover, p. 1. Tenth Manuscript Census of the United States (1880), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Mason County, Dover, p. 7. “Curran Thomas A,” Headstones Provided for Deceased Union Civil War Veterans. Record of Appointment of Postmasters, 1832-1971, NARA Microfilm Publication, M841, Records of the Post Office Department, Record Group Number 28, pg.121 (accessed via Ancestry.com).
